question: Can you help me plan a week-long trip to Japan, focusing on historical sites and local cuisine?
true_answer: The trip plan includes visits to Kyoto, Nara, and Hiroshima, with highlights on historical landmarks and recommended local dining experiences.

steps.description: Identify local cuisines in key cities
Create itinerary for a week-long trip

plan.current_objective: Plan a week-long trip to Japan focusing on historical sites and cuisine.

memory_state.shared_knowledge: Kyoto, Nara, and Hiroshima are rich in historical sites; top recommended cuisines include Kaiseki and Okonomiyaki.

steps.content: Can you help me plan a week-long trip to Japan, focusing on historical sites and local cuisine?
Creating initial plan: 1) Research historical sites. 2) Identify local cuisines. 3) Draft itinerary.
Decomposing tasks into site research, cuisine identification, and itinerary creation.
Assigning historical site research to researcher.
Searching for historical sites in prominent Japanese cities.
Kyoto: Kinkaku-ji, Fushimi Inari-taisha; Nara: Todai-ji; Hiroshima: Peace Memorial Park.
Marking historical site research as complete. Updating shared knowledge.
Assigning cuisine identification task to browser.
Finding popular local cuisines in Kyoto, Nara, and Hiroshima.
Kyoto: Kaiseki; Nara: Kakinoha Sushi; Hiroshima: Okonomiyaki.
Cuisine identification complete. Updating shared knowledge.
Feedback: Ensure travel times and accessibility to sites are considered in itinerary.
Incorporating feedback into final itinerary draft.
The trip plan includes visits to Kyoto, Nara, and Hiroshima, with highlights on historical landmarks and recommended local dining experiences.
